column4: So what could be the problem that natty does not launch my sh programs
Are you making your sh programs +x ?
Do they have the #!/bin/bash     shebang as first line?
( or /bin/sh or other shell as you like )
i have not made that program, its netbeans 7.0 and jdk 6
If it is java, and not shell script, are you running the program as like:/usr/bin/java ./local-java-appname
I just downloaded netbeans 7.0 from web and executed it, no wizrd comes up ever
So, you downloaded some source file for netbeans? Why not instead: sudo apt-cache update &&  sudo apt-get install netbeans                            ?
the first command there should be sudo apt-get update and not apt-cache, apologies
because sudo does not have 7.0 it is for 6.9 only
thats why i downloaded it and tried to execute, but it works well on 10.10 but not on 11.04
Then to: sudo /bin/sh ./<netbeans-filename.sh>     when you are in the directory that file sits
